intro: Gladiolus luteolus, commonly known as the yellow gladiolus, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features tall, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with its inflorescence consisting of a spike of brightly colored blooms. Its flowers are composed of three outer petals and three inner tepals, forming a distinctive, almost sword-like shape. The plant is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
